intro: Paraboea scortechinii, commonly known as the mountain mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the shade of dense forests. Its leaves are typically small, elliptical, and arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Paraboea scortechinii is often found in humid, cool environments and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
